channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1188; 03:41PM; 1150 E 105th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TznE8z; #GreenMeadows; The first 16 firefighters arrived, and deployed hose lines and made access to the one-story home, making an aggressive interior fire attack to contain the fire to the room-of-origin, and extinguish the flames in 13 minutes. No other structures damaged. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC13 E21 E264 E33 E64 E65 RA264 RA864 SO1 SQ21 T33 T64; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1188; 03:28PM; 1150 E 105th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TznE8z; #GreenMeadows; One-story single-family home with fire showing, and one other structure threatened. Offensive mode.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC13 E21 E264 E33 E64 E65 RA264 RA864 SQ21 T33 T64; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Landslide; INC#0153; 02:51AM; 3741 N Ventura Canyon Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/4cgDn3U; #ShermanOaks; Firefighters responded to reports of a large tree down and wires down in the backyard of a residence. Responders arrived to find a large portion of a hillside had slid down toward at least three homes. Several people have been evacuated from at least one of the homes. A primary search of the homes revealed no patients, but a more thorough (secondary) search will be conducted after daybreak. Department of Building and Safety is responding to assess the structures and hillsides. PIO Captain Cody Weireter is now on scene.; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC14 CM40 CM42 E278 E288 E99 PI3 RA78 T78 T88 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0152; 02:45AM; 7200 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/4c7xgih; #Hollywood; LAFD responded to a two-story garden-style apartment building with fire showing from one unit. It took 26 firefighters 22 minutes to contain the fire to the unit-of-origin and extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 BC706 E227 E235 E261 E27 E41 E76 E82 RA41 RA827 T27 T35 T61; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0939; 02:27PM; 2411 S Alma St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ti6Gdk; #SanPedro; Firefighters arrived to find a 1,946 sq-ft single-story home (built in 1919) with smoke showing from the attic vents. Firefighters discovered a fire, which appeared to have started in the kitchen near cooking equipment, and traveled through a concealed space and into the attic. Crews ascended ladders to the roof to ventilate from above, as other crews accessed the attic with hose lines through the ceiling from inside. It took 32 firefighters 22 minutes to extinguish the attic fire. Firefighters rescued two dogs while performing an interior search. Functional smoke alarms alerted both residents promptly, and the 92-year-old female and 90-year-old male were able to safely escape. One of the occupants of the home (90-M) was assessed by paramedics out of an abundance of caution, and found to be in good condition (no hospital transport or further care needed). No reported injuries.; FS 101; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 BC6 E101 E112 E238 E248 E48 RA101 RA36 RA38 T38 T48; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0939; 02:05PM; 2411 S Alma St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ti6Gdk; #SanPedro; PRELIM: One-story single-family home with smoke showing from the attic. Offensive mode.; FS 101; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 BC6 E101 E112 E238 E248 E48 RA101 RA36 RA38 T38 T48; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1433; 10:15PM; 524 E 33rd St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48Nd3eC; #HistoricSouthCentral; 44 LAFD Firefighters took just 17 minutes to access, confine and extinguish fire in the rear corner and attic of a 1,986 square foot one-story home (built 1906), preventing fire spread to an adjacent structure. Six civilians who were in our near the home at the time of the fire are being evaluated for non-specific complaints, including possible smoke exposure. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC13 E14 E15 E215 E221 E46 EM11 RA14 RA15 RA17 RA814 RA9 SO1 SQ21 T15 T21; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1433; 09:58PM; 524 E 33rd St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48Nd3eC; #HistoricSouthCentral; PRELIM: Heavy fire in the rear of a one-story home, with fire threatening an adjacent structure.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC13 E14 E15 E215 E221 E46 EM11 RA14 RA15 RA814 SQ21 T15 T21; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Helicopter Hoist Rescue; INC#0442; 09:42AM; Haines Canyon Mountainway; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wQ51o4; #Tujunga; LAFD ground and air response to the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains, for a 40 year-old male mountain bicyclist injured in a fall. A hovering LAFD Rescue Helicopter was able to find the patient, and lowered a Flight Paramedic to evaluate and medically stabilize the patient, who sustained a back injury. The patient and rescuer will soon be hoisted aboard the LAFD helicopter for continuing medical care during direct transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 E24 E274 E290 H1 H4 H5 HA1 HA4 HA5 PB74 RA74 RA874 RH114 SO1 T74 T90; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1594; 09:37PM; 14737 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/4a5irL5; #VanNuys; 39 LAFD Firefighters took just 17 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish a contents fire in one room of a 2nd floor apartment in a 49,263 square foot, 82 unit, three-story O-shaped garden style apartment building (built 1969). No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 E239 E288 E290 E39 E81 E90 RA39 RA81 RA889 SO1 T39 T88 T90; CH9; 18; Brian Humphrey
